p: Although sunflower and rapeseed breeding demonstrate certain similar traits, there exists significant differences in the directions of the selection process in these two crops. The oil from rapeseed naturally contains high quantities of erucic acid and glucosinolates. Due to this fact, the use of rapeseed oil in food industry was restricted because of its physiopathological effect on mammals ( Borg, 1975). These limitations were overcome in the 1960s by the production of rapeseed whose oil was free from erucic acid ( Stefansson & Hougen, 1964).
